alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 01 at 1:55PM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn affecting Marquette County. ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint) affecting Iron County. Chocolay River near Harvey affecting Marquette County. ...The Flood Advisory is cancelled for the following rivers in Michigan... Middle Branch Escanaba River at Humboldt affecting Marquette County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Elevated river levels caused by excessive rainfall continue. * WHERE...East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Low lying areas of Peter Nordeen Park begin to flood * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 6.2 feet tomorrow evening. It will then rise to 6.8 feet Sunday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Action stage is 6.5 feet. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 300 PM EDT /200 PM CDT/.
